body:
Concept ACK, though to avoid clients having to do additional string parsing, i'd slightly prefer a list instead of one `|`-separated string. E.g.
```
"localservicesnames": ["NODE_NETWORK", "NODE_WITNESS", "NODE_NETWORK_LIMITED"]
```
or leave out the `NODE_` as it's redundant,
```
"localservicesnames": ["NETWORK", "WITNESS", "NETWORK_LIMITED"]
```
Updated to use a list instead of a ` | `-separated string and to remove the redundant `NODE_` prefix. Will add CHANGELOG too.
Rebased to point in the help that only known services are decoded, and to group the decoding into one function as suggested by @MarcoFalke

<!--e57a25ab6845829454e8d69fc972939a-->

The following sections might be updated with supplementary metadata relevant to reviewers and maintainers.

<!--174a7506f384e20aa4161008e828411d-->
### Conflicts
Reviewers, this pull request conflicts with the following ones:

* [#16839](https://drahtbot.github.io/bitcoin_core_issue_redirect/r/16839.html) (Replace Connman and BanMan globals with Node local by ryanofsky)
* [#16411](https://drahtbot.github.io/bitcoin_core_issue_redirect/r/16411.html) (Signet support by kallewoof)

If you consider this pull request important, please also help to review the conflicting pull requests. Ideally, start with the one that should be merged first.
*(Travis is failing for mysterious reasons but the build is passing on https://bitcoinbuilds.org/?build=1484 fwiw :-) )*

> (Travis is failing for mysterious reasons but the build is passing on https://bitcoinbuilds.org/?build=1484 fwiw :-) )

yeahh Travis is having infrastructure issues again (I think), restarted the failing jobs …
Rebased to fix the last doc nits (and hopefully make Travis happy).

Works for me
ACK 66740f460af5f9d8c61eb5b154863bffb20d94b5
Please add a (functional) tests for this feature in a next PR

> Please add a (functional) tests for this feature in a next PR

Will do

diff_hunk:
@@ -82,6 +82,10 @@ static UniValue getpeerinfo(const JSONRPCRequest& request)
             "    \"addrbind\":\"ip:port\",    (string) Bind address of the connection to the peer\n"
             "    \"addrlocal\":\"ip:port\",   (string) Local address as reported by the peer\n"
             "    \"services\":\"xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx\",   (string) The services offered\n"
+            "    \"servicesnames\":[              (array) the services offered, in human-readable form\n"
body: Should mention that unrecognised services are not shown

Couldn't this be in a function, so that only one place has to be updated in the future?
```suggestion
        obj.pushKV("servicesnames", GetServicesNames(stats.nServices));
```

diff_hunk:
@@ -82,6 +82,10 @@ static UniValue getpeerinfo(const JSONRPCRequest& request)
             "    \"addrbind\":\"ip:port\",    (string) Bind address of the connection to the peer\n"
             "    \"addrlocal\":\"ip:port\",   (string) Local address as reported by the peer\n"
             "    \"services\":\"xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx\",   (string) The services offered\n"
+            "    \"servicesnames\":[              (array) the services offered, in human-readable form\n"

@@ -446,6 +451,10 @@ static UniValue getnetworkinfo(const JSONRPCRequest& request)
             "  \"subversion\": \"/Satoshi:x.x.x/\",     (string) the server subversion string\n"
             "  \"protocolversion\": xxxxx,              (numeric) the protocol version\n"
             "  \"localservices\": \"xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx\", (string) the services we offer to the network\n"
+            "  \"localservicesnames\": [              (array) the known services we offer to the network, in human-readable form\n"
body: unknown services can not be offered, so mentioning it here will cause confusion

diff_hunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,3 @@
+RPC changes
+-----------
+The `getnetworkinfo` and `getpeerinfo` commands now contains a new field with decoded network service flags.

@@ -446,6 +451,10 @@ static UniValue getnetworkinfo(const JSONRPCRequest& request)
             "  \"subversion\": \"/Satoshi:x.x.x/\",     (string) the server subversion string\n"
             "  \"protocolversion\": xxxxx,              (numeric) the protocol version\n"
             "  \"localservices\": \"xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx\", (string) the services we offer to the network\n"
+            "  \"localservicesnames\": [              (array) the services we offer to the network, in human-readable form\n"
+            "      \"SERVICE_NAME\",         (string) the service name if it is recognised\n"
body: nit: could put some more whitespace before "(string)" for optics

diff_hunk:
@@ -446,6 +451,10 @@ static UniValue getnetworkinfo(const JSONRPCRequest& request)
             "  \"subversion\": \"/Satoshi:x.x.x/\",     (string) the server subversion string\n"
             "  \"protocolversion\": xxxxx,              (numeric) the protocol version\n"
             "  \"localservices\": \"xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx\", (string) the services we offer to the network\n"
+            "  \"localservicesnames\": [              (array) the services we offer to the network, in human-readable form\n"
+            "      \"SERVICE_NAME\",         (string) the service name if it is recognised\n"
body:
If you need to change this for other reasons, might as well remove the "if it is recognised". If we offer a service, we better recognize it.
```suggestion
            "      \"SERVICE_NAME\",         (string) the service name\n"
```

body: [As mentioned above](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/16787#discussion_r321023855), `getnetworkinfo` indicates service we offer : we'd better recognise it
